toc_entry.title: Happy Trails To You
toc_entry.description: Forget the San Jacinto Monument and the alamo. Here are trails that will lead you to Lee Harvey Oswald’s can opener, tranquil country cemeteries, the world’s largest jackrabbit, peanut butter pie, and even more.

toc_entry.title: The Real Governor Of Texas
toc_entry.description: Wearing black robes, he swept into power and now rules from an office he will hold for life.

toc_entry.title: Doing What Comes Naturally
toc_entry.subtitle: Design
toc_entry.description: A lifelong aversion to sleek steel high rises and modern fads has made o’neil Ford the grand old maverick of Texas architecture.

toc_entry.title: Little Bruisers
toc_entry.description: Fighters from all over Texas slug it out in the Golden Gloves; for most, that’s the only gold they’ll ever see.

toc_entry.title: Currying Flavor
toc_entry.subtitle: Dining Out
toc_entry.description: If you think lamb korma is a woolly creature with good vibes, you’ve got a lot to learn about Indian food.

toc_entry.title: Uphill Racer
toc_entry.subtitle: Lifestyles
toc_entry.description: If the race is to the swift, what’s left over for the slow?

toc_entry.title: Our Bodies, Our Cells
toc_entry.subtitle: Health
toc_entry.description: Life is a riddle. Cancer is a riddle. Are they the same riddle?

toc_entry.title: The Texas Monthly Reporter
toc_entry.description: Taking on the Shah of Iran in Beeville; trying to save an eaglet in Waco; juggling sex in Galveston; flipping the switch on nuclear power; and fighting panic at monstrous DFW airport.

toc_entry.title: The Texas Monthly Review
toc_entry.description: Texas lights shine on Broadway; Dallas Symphony waxes on record; mellow Willie Nelson grows more mellow; Duke Ellington plays live again; and Stella’s exotic birds fly.

toc_entry.title: The Inside Story
toc_entry.description: Good sports and green grape cobbler.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: A selective guide to entertainment and events of more than usual interest.
